intro: Arctotis crispata, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery, crinkled leaves and bright yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance. Arctotis crispata is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
